item.title: Go - Project Structure
item.description: I am sure, how to structure a Go Project, would have been most obvious question which everybody have thought through and it is very obvious. Specially after we write some basic hello world which has only main.go or after doing workouts in Go Playground As we step up and write more code which involve various layering, then it becomes very essential to organize the code, so that:- easy to understand and maintain each package purpose becomes self explanatory by it’s name reduce interdependencies in the code increase code reusability ease of collaboration Well, you can think of more points, but the fact is, it is very important to follow a basic template which is set a as standard by various GO projects ( GO doesn’t provide any official docs on project structure as such) and later on top of that, one can evolve their own structure as needed.
item.dc:creator: Neeraj Sidhaye
